questions.question_text: Which is NOT a component of a hardware asset's lifecycle?

discussion.content: Consume only applies to consumable hardware - not all hardware. Thus C is the answer

Selected Answer: C
Page 19 of Vancouver edition as well

Selected Answer: C
C is correct
C is correct, page 19 of Tokyo Book

questions.question_text: When creating a list report that groups all assets by product model, which table is used?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Answer is A - All assets alm_assets
Alm_hardware will show only hardware assets

Selected Answer: A
Answer: A. alm_asset

Explanation: alm_model and alm_model_category not part of the OOB Asset Management install, alm_hardware only stores hardware information while alm_asset stores ALL assets, so would be best table to run report on assets groups by product model (or in general)

Source: https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/vancouver-it-asset-management/page/product/asset-management/reference/r_InstalledWithAssetManagement.html

Selected Answer: A
Checked on Learning Instance: 
1. Navigate to alm_asset
2. Add Model column
3. From context Bar Chart
4. Name of the report: Bar on Asset table by Model

Selected Answer: D
Correct answer is alm_hardware (Hardware) table

questions.question_text: Assets can be scanned and created in ServiceNow via the Agent mobile application in which scenarios? (Choose two.)

choices.A: Create a single asset via barcode scan
choices.D: Create a single asset via Name search
choices.B: Receive one or multiple assets from a purchase order
choices.C: Create multiple assets listed on a contract PDF scan

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AB
Page 392 Vancouver text

choices.B: The content is not available from the Content Service
choices.A: You have opted out of the Content Service
choices.E: The content has not been downloaded from the Content Service
choices.D: Something on your model form may be badly formatted
choices.C: Your model form contains a good Model number, but a bad model Name

questions.question_text: When viewing the Model Management tab of the Hardware Asset dashboard, you see that several models are reported as Match Not Found. What are potential causes of this? (Choose three.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BDE
B D E are correct

Selected Answer: BDE
Not Normalized includes 'Match not found' which means something is either
badly formatted, or the content is not yet available from the Content Service
(either not downloaded or simply not available).
